history.narrative: Law 14-189, the “Human Rights Amendment Act of 2002”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 14-132, which was referred to the Committee on Human Rights, Latino Affairs and Property. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 7, 2002, and June 4, 2002, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 26, 2002, it was assigned Act No. 14-399 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 14-189 became effective on October 1, 2002.
